se.cbb.jprime.prm

Class Dependency

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.prm.Dependency
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Dependency>

    public final class Dependency
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Dependency>
    Represents a parent-child PRM dependency relationship between two probabilistic PRM attributes, possibly linked via a 'slot chain' (an ordered list of relations). Instances are supposed to be immutable.

    A dependency represents a parent-child arc in the "template graph". These scenarios can occur for a parent attribute P and a child attribute C:

    1. P and C belong to the same PRM class with an empty slot chain, i.e., the same entity.
    2. P and C belong to the same PRM class but are linked via a slot chain, i.e., they may be in different entities.
    3. P and C belong to different PRM classes linked via a slot chain.
    Note that this implies that we may have more than one arc for the same P and C, albeit with different slot chains.

    For many-to-one and one-to-one relations, we allow caching (creating an "index") of entity indices from C to P, enabling quicker lookups.

    Two instances of this class are considered equal if they refer to the same child-parents and have identical slot chains.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dependency

        public Dependency(ProbAttribute child,
          java.util.List<Relation> slotChain,
          ProbAttribute parent,
          boolean createIndex)
        Creates a dependency. Does not perform verification of slot chain validity, dependency constraints, etc.
        Parameters:
        child - child attribute.
        slotChain - slot chain from child to attribute. Null is interpreted as empty.
        parent - parent attribute.
        createIndex - if true, creates an index. Only applicable for certain relation types.

    • Method Detail

      • getSingleParentEntity

        public int getSingleParentEntity(int idx)
        Follows an entity from child to parent, assuming that the encountered relations will never yield more than one record in return.
        Returns:
        the presumably single parent entity.

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns the length of the slot chain of this dependency, i.e., 0 if the attributes belong to the same PRM class without relations in between.
        Returns:
        the length.

      • hasSlotChain

        public boolean hasSlotChain()
        Returns true if this dependency makes use of a slot chain, i.e. there are relations between parent and child attributes.
        Returns:
        true if there is a slot chain.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the dependency's name thus: A1.Alpha.A2<-B1.Beta.B2<-G1.Gamma.G2 for a child-parent dependency over classes Alpha, Beta and Gamma, with the child attribute A1 in Alpha and parent attribute G2 in Gamma. With an empty slot chain, this reduces to A1.Alpha.A2.

        This string may also be used to identify identical dependencies.

        Returns:
        a unique string representation.

      • getChild

        public ProbAttribute getChild()
        Returns the child attribute.
        Returns:
        the child.

      • getParent

        public ProbAttribute getParent()
        Returns the parent attribute.
        Returns:
        the parent.

      • createIndex

        public boolean createIndex()
        Creates a lookup table relating entities of the child C to its parent P for quicker access. If unable to do so (e.g. by a one-to-many relation in the slot chain), false is returned.
        Returns:
        true if index was created, false if index could not be created.

      • hasIndex

        public boolean hasIndex()
        Returns true if caching has been enabled.
        Returns:

      • isLatent

        public boolean isLatent()
        Returns true if the child attribute or the parent attribute is latent.
        Returns:
        true if any of the attributes latent.
